DOC.brief_summary: The objective study assess performance safety sirolimus-eluting , heparin-coated , cobalt chromium balloon-expandable stent ( Small Vessel Stent ) patient de novo native coronary artery lesion small vessel compare historical data small vessel patient RAVEL trial receive Sirolimus-eluting Bx VELOCITYâ„¢ stent .
DOC.brief_title: Evaluation Sirolimus-Eluting , Heparin-Coated CoCr Stent Treatment de Novo Coronary Artery Lesions Small Vessels ( EVOLUTION )
DOC.criteria: 1 . The patient must minimum 18 year age ; 2 . Diagnosis angina pectoris define Canadian Cardiovascular Society Classification ( CCS I , II , III , IV ) OR unstable angina pectoris ( Braunwald Classification B & C , IIIIII ) OR patient document silent ischemia ; 3 Treatment one lesion native coronary artery . The treated lesion one high % diameter stenosis visual estimate . Additional study stent may use procedural complication dissection . Multivessel treatment permissible nontarget vessel ; however , additional lesion may treat commercial stent . If nontarget vessel treat commercial stent index procedure , must successfully treat prior study lesion ; 4 . The target lesion > /=2.0 mm < /=2.5mm diameter ( visual estimate ) ; 5 . The target lesion cover single 18mm stent ; 6 . Target lesion stenosis > 50 % < 100 % ( TIMI I ) ( visual estimate ) ; 1 . Patient experience Qwave nonQwave myocardial infarction document total CK > 2 time normal within precede 24 hour CK CKMB enzymes remain normal time treatment ; 2 . Target lesion due instent restenosis ; 3 . Ejection fraction 30 % ; 4 . Totally occluded vessel ( TIMI 0 level ) ; 5 . Impaired renal function ( creatinine > 3.0 mg/dL ) ;
